data.title: Check opaque pixel for TextureButton
data.body: A button can take a lot of forms, that are not always a square. But in TextureButton, that doesn't matter at all. If it's a triangle or a circle, it'll activate even when it's not in the texture itself. I suggest adding a "Check for opaque pixels" option in the TextureButton.

data.title: Cannot draw in global space from a child node
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3, Windows 10, 64 bits

I am trying to use `_draw()` to display a sort of particle system in global space, because the ParticleSystem2D is not suited for my case.

I don't want to move my node to the root because I prefer to have it part of my objects, so I am using this workaround to counter all local transforms:

``` gdscript
    var inv = get_global_transform().inverse()
    draw_set_transform(inv.get_origin(), inv.get_rotation(), inv.get_scale())
```

It appears to work, but if I scale the parent node the position is incorrect.
Here is a minimal project showing the issue: 
[GlobalSpace.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/333645/GlobalSpace.zip)

Is this a bug? Or am I doing something wrong?

data.title: Color picker presets should be saved with the project settings
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Any

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Color picker presets should be saved into the project.

If I set a color as a preset, so I can modulate the same sprite to different colors. After saving the project, closing and re-open Godot editor, the preset values are lost.
It will be an easier workflow if the color presets are saved in the project settings file.

I don't know if there is any drawback in saving the presets in project settings.
The documentation says the color picker set_preset function is local to that specific instance of Colorpicker control. But if I set a preset, then I can see the same preset in another sprite's modulate picker. If it is local, then why it is showing in another object's picker instance?

data.title: Exported app to iOS crashes due SIGSEGV.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
iOS 9.3.2 (I don't have data to say that it does not happen in other versions), most likely only ARM-64 based devices especially newer tablets (iPad Pro 12.9", iPad mini 4 etc.). 
Godot 2.0.0 - 2.0.3, Xcode 7.3.1 (7D1014)
Devices from crashlogs (from iTunesConnect obtained via Xcode):
- tablets: iPad4,1 (iPad Air); iPad5,1 (iPad Mini 4); iPad6,7 (iPad Pro 12.9");
- phones: iPhone7,2 (iPhone 6); iPhone6,1 (iPhone 5S);  

(nice table with model ID [here](http://i.stack.imgur.com/g0nwf.jpg) )

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Exported app crashes usually during first few seconds or 1 - 2 minutes. Rarely it happens after longer period (tens of minutes).  Unfortunately it does not happen on my device iPad Mini 2 and devices of people I know: iPhone 6, iPhone 5, iPhone 5S. So it definitively does not happen all the time.

On other platforms (Android, Win, Linux) it works without crashes.

data.title: In-scene scripts with parse errors do not get saved before scene playing
data.body:
Windows 10  64bit, Godot 2.0.x **except** 2.0.1

Scripts saved in-scene are not saved after a parse error. Issue appeared in 2.0.2.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene, make a node of any kind, attach an in-scene script (Script property)
2. Add some valid code

```
func _ready():
    pass
func somefunc():
    pass
```
1. Press the Play current scene button. No errors should happen.
2. Cause a syntax error in the code (for example remove `pass` with the indentation)
3. Press the Play current scene button, a parse error should appear
4. Fix the error (or just ctrl+z)
5. Press the Play current scene button, a parse error appears indicating the script was not saved

**Workaround:**
To force save - press Play current scene in the scene editor (first click on any node to return to the scene view).

Fun fact:
If you create a script with only `func _ready():` with no newlines there are no parsing errors.

Kinematic objects don't detect static objects marked with on-way collision, when the angle between that movement vector and the one-way vector is below a certain angle.

Below, a project demonstrating this problem.
[BadKino.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/333507/BadKino.zip)

data.title: AnimationPlayer + AnimatedSprite: Keyframing a frame no longer increments the frame count for the next step
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro. Latest compile from GitHub repo.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When keying a frame on an AnimatedSprite into a timeline in an AnimationPlayer, the key button beside "Frame" has lost the ability to increment the frame by 1 and move on to the next step in the timeline after a click, automatically.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Make a scene and add an AnimatedSprite node.
2. Edit "Frames" on the AnimatedSprite node and add SpriteFrames.
3. Add some sprites into the SpriteFrames, maybe 3 - 5 or more.
4. In the same scene, add an AnimationPlayer node, click on it and create a new animation to start keying into the timeline.
5. Now key the "Frames" on the AnimatedSprite node into the timeline.
6. Notice that whenever you click on the key button beside "Frame", it doesn't get incremented by 1 and move to the next step in the timeline automatically anymore. 

This button used to have this ability, so even if we have hundreds of frames, we can just mash click this key button beside "Frame" and all the frames on the AnimatedSprite node get keyed into the timeline really fast.

data.title: Fix issue when switching between FileSystem and other editor docks
Improve android payment
data.body:
- fixed a bug `requestPurchased` that can't get all information if user purchased many items and not consumed
- added `querySkuDetails` to get detail information of IAP items.
- clean unnecessary codes and styles.

The price of in-app item has different value along user's country on android.
with `querySkuDetails`, we can display actual price and currency along user's country.

I tested it Android 19, 23 devices and made demo for it.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/pull/6

And this PR need #5390 also, because `querySkuDetails` uses java string array.

data.title: Mismatching names: RealArray vs. FloatArray
data.body:
There is a mismatch between those names when considering scripts and exposed interface. In the class reference you can find a `RealArray` (which is the internal C++ name) but in script code you can only use `FloatArray`. `VariantParser` also uses `FloatArray`.
#3654 was closed because `RealArray` was exposed to documentation. But since everywhere else in the exposed side (including custom properties and how text formats are saved) uses `FloatArray`, that should be proper name?

I have the opinion that C++ API and Script API shouldn't have different names. It'll make easier for a Godot user to understand the C++ code if they found familiar names in the API. There's also the name difference between `RawArray` (as exposed) and `ByteArray` (as used internally).

Is it implemented somewhere else, or is it missing?

data.title: Texture not repeating if mipmapping not activated
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - Godot v2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I create a Polygon2D and set texture with Repeat Flag the texture is stretched instead of being repeated. If I activate the Mipmaps Flag then the texture is repeated properly.

PS: I don't want mipmapping because I want my texture to be pixel perfect.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a scene
2. Add a Polygon2D
3. Draw a shape with the polygon tool
4. Add a Texture
5. Toggle the Mipmaps Flag with the Repeat Flag activated

Thank you

data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit, 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I call `force_update_scroll()` to a Camera2D with smoothing enabled, I expect it to center the followed Node immediately.
For me I have no way to jump with the camera to a specific position without smoothing and enable smoothing right afterwards.

data.title: VideoPlayer: Added started,paused,stopped,finished signals
data.body:
- fixes #5377
- started is emitted on play()
- paused is emitted when going from not paused state to paused state
- stopped is emitted when the stream was playing on a call to stop
- finished is emitted when the stream naturally stops(runs out)
- also cleaned up the files a bit, removed some unnecessary prints, changed some `fprintf(stderr` prints into `ERR_PRINT`

data.title: Optimize member access with self
data.body:
Let the compiler take the fast path when a member is superfluously accessed with `self.`.

Apparently fixes #5404, but in that case this is only masking the underlying issue.
